definition: electronic equipment consisting of a small crystal of a silicon semiconductor fabricated to carry out a number of electronic functions in an integrated circuit
opposite_reasoning: ComputerSoftware is the strongest opposite for ComputerHardware based on: (1) Well-established complementary dichotomy in computing - hardware/software are the two fundamental components of computer systems; (2) Clear semantic opposition: physical/tangible vs. abstract/intangible, material vs. informational; (3) High availability - definitely exists in both WordNet and SUMO; (4) Useful for Fisher-LDA separation as they occupy distinct semantic spaces despite both being computing-related; (5) Relevant for AI safety contexts where distinguishing physical substrate from abstract algorithms/programs matters. This is a textbook example of complementary opposition.
